page.title: 09Education in Hexham
page.content: {Dukeshouse Wood Centre}for field study and outdoor activities belongs to Gateshead and Cleveland L.E.A.It is situated 1Km from Hexham in open and wooded countryside and the site covers 18 acres.It takes up to 152 residential children aged 11-19 each week from Gateshead schools,with their teachers.Each child pays Â£1.50 per day towards his keep.Mr.Miller,the headmaster,has 4 full time teachers and 18 domestic staff.The school was built in 1938 and children come to enjoy the countryside,do canoeing, ,caving orienteering and other outdoor activities.The wooden buildings of dormitories,various offices,and classrooms. {Adult Education}is available in many subjects,and nearly 1000 adults go to evening and day classes in the area, both for qualification and enjoyment.
